result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Q. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler Q. Hayes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyler Q. Hayes was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 6 days, if revoked.
Motion to grant expungement upon successful completion of probation is denied by the Court.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Perform  25    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  Credit for 6 days if revoked.  14CF174 and 13CF972 are Concurrent.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 25 hours of community service.  Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs and surcharges.  Cash Bond on deposit in 14CF174 & 13CF972 are to be applied between both files.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Motion to grant expungement upon successful completion of probation is denied by the Court.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Court has reviewed letter from probation agent and DE is ordered to make his appointments.  Sentencing adj. to allow additional time to complete PSI.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 7/9/15 at 10:30 AM as this case is assigned to ADA Trigg.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bielski requests an adjournment pending the outcome of their appeal and request is denied.  Atty Bielski requests the jury trial in 13CF972 be changed to a plea on 5/18/15.  Plea Hearing 5/18/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for Attorney Emily Trigg and for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bielski states cases remain unresolved as there is another case that is on appeal in Branch 4 and no global offer has been made.  ADA Drees states this is ADA Trigg's case and will provide a global offer today.  ADA Trigg  requests the next status be scheduled on ADA Trigg's week.  Status Conf. on 5/6/15 at 10:00 AM
7/21/14 - Status Conference (Filed in 13CF236)
4/23/14 - Status Conference (Filed in 13CF236)

and  Demand for Discovery

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bielski states there is an appeal pending in another case in Branch 4 and requests an adjournment.  Scheduling order is given to parties and court sets older case 13CF972 for trial and this case will trial.  Status Conf. on 3/18/15 at 10:40 AM and on 5/18/15 at 8:30 AM.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J. Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bielski states Atty Trigg just forwarded material over to the Attorney General's office last week and requests an adjournment pending outcome of appeal that is before Branch 4; no objection by the State.  FPT on 1/30/15 at 11:00 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J. Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bielski requests an adjournment pending outcome of Deft's underlying case in Branch 4 on 11/7 at 9:30 and waiting on an appeal decision.  Status Conf. on 11/7/14 at 9:40 AM.

MINUTES:  13CF972, 14CF174, 14TR963-14TR965:  Cases were separated from 13CF236.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

MINUTES:  Case to trail 13CF236.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant, Tyler Q. Hayes, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Atty Bielski provided the court with a copy of the recent Court of Appeals decision in State v. Court sets matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
